data.title: Museum of Visual Arts (Santiago)
data.meta_description: Museum of Visual Arts is a museum in Santiago. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The Museum of Visual Arts (MAVI) is situated in the vibrant Lastarria neighborhood of Santiago, Chile. It is conveniently located next to the Archaeological Museum of Santiago, in the Mulato Gil de Castro Square. This location makes it easily accessible for tourists who are exploring the city and are interested in immersing themselves in Chilean art and culture.

History and Collection of the Museum of Visual Arts

The Museum of Visual Arts was founded in 2000 and officially opened its doors to the public in 2001. It boasts a collection of 650 works from over 300 Chilean artists. This extensive collection provides a comprehensive overview of Chilean visual arts, making it a valuable destination for tourists interested in understanding and appreciating the country's artistic heritage.
